title: Fuji-Q Highland Walking Tour 4K | Discover Japans Most Intense Theme Park With Mount Fuji Views
description:
Take a virtual stroll through Fuji-Q Highland, the world-famous theme park sitting at the base of Mount Fuji. Known for its record-breaking roller coasters and spine-chilling haunted attractions, this 6-minute 4K walking tour captures the high-energy atmosphere and breathtaking scenery of Japanâ€™s ultimate "Screaming Resort."

In this video, we explore the parkâ€™s main plazas, get up close to the massive steel structures of world-record holders like Fujiyama and Takabisha, and catch stunning glimpses of Mount Fuji towering over the horizon.

Whether youâ€™re planning a trip to Yamanashi or just want to experience the sights and sounds of Japanâ€™s most intense rides from home, this immersive tour is for you.

ğŸ“ Whatâ€™s Inside:
The Big Four: Visuals of the legendary coasters: Fujiyama, Eejanaika, Takabisha, and Do-Dodonpa.

Naruto & Boruto Fuji Hidden Leaf Village: Explore the immersive anime-themed area.

Mt. Fuji Views: The best spots in the park to capture the iconic volcano.

Park Atmosphere: The sounds of screams, gears, and Japanese park music in crisp 4K.

00:01- Entering Park
02:40 - Naruto X Boruto Fuji Hidden Leaf Village.
03:40 - Walking Around Takabisha Coaster
05:18 - Mt Fuji Views

ğŸ’¡ Pro Tips for Visiting Fuji-Q:
Get the Free Pass: If you plan on riding more than 3 big coasters, the day pass is much more cost-effective.

Priority Passes: Lines for the "Big Four" can exceed 2 hours. Buy "Zekkyo Priority Tickets" to skip the wait!

Check the Weather: Fuji-Q rides often close for high winds or rain. Plus, youâ€™ll want a clear day to see the mountain!

Access: Take the Fuji Excursion train from Shinjuku or the highway bus for a direct route from Tokyo.

Enjoyed the tour? ğŸ‘ Like this video if you're a roller coaster fan! ğŸ”” Subscribe for more 4K Japan walking tours and travel guides. ğŸ’¬ Comment Below: Which of the "Big Four" coasters would you be brave enough to ride?

#FujiQHighland #JapanTravel #MountFuji #RollerCoasters #4KWalkingTour #ThemePark #JapanGuide #VisitJapan #Fujiyama #Takabisha

title: Wakutama-ike pond on the east side of Fujisan HongÅ« Sengen Taisha Shrine is fed by Mount Fuji snow
description:
This red bridge crosses sacred water flowing straight from Mount Fujiâ€¦ and it never freezes, no matter how cold it gets.

ğŸ“Œ Save this for your Japan travel plans

In my quest to find off the beaten pathâ€ views of Mount Fuji, I stumble upon this shrine and this magical pond. 

On the east side of Fujisan HongÅ« Sengen Taisha Shrine you find this pond believed to have sacred waters.

The Wakutama-ike pond is fed by meltwater that seeps through Mount Fujiâ€™s lava rocks. About 200,000 tons every single day. The water stays 14Â°C all year and never freezes. No matter how cold it gets in the Winter.

Itâ€™s so pure it was chosen as one of the 100 Best Waters of the Heisei Era.

This is ğŸ‘‡

ğŸ“Wakutama-ike Pond at Fujisan HongÅ« Sengen Taisha located at the foot of Mount Fuji in Fujinomiya, Shizuoka, Japan

âœ… Travel Info:

ğŸŸï¸ The Shrine and pond are Free to enter. 

ğŸš‚ About 10 minutesâ€™ walk from JR Fujinomiya Train Station. 

â° I visited early morning and got mirror-clear reflections in the water, the light was beautiful and  Mount Fuji across the pond was starting to clear out.

This place is proof that even volcanoes can create outstanding beauty.

#beautifuldestinations #japan #mountfuji #shrine #bridge

Mt. Fuji nature & glamping with my dog
description:
Discover 7 of the best nature spots around Mt Fuji to visit with your dog! ğŸ¾ While we filmed this during the stunning autumn season, these locations offer breathtaking views, glamping, and peaceful walks all year round.
If you are looking for a quiet, stress-free escape from city life, join us on this "Slow Life" road trip through Yamanashi Prefecture. From waterfalls to hidden villages, we found the perfect places for a pet-friendly getaway.
ğŸ“ In this video:
We spent three relaxing days exploring dog-friendly spots with our dachshund, Momo-chan. Whether you are planning a Japan road trip or just want to enjoy the scenery, this guide covers:

Mt Fuji Views: Iconic spots and hidden gems near the mountain.
Nature Walks: The majestic Shiraito Waterfall, serene lakes, and forest corridors.
Glamping & Culture: The historic Saiko Iyashi-no-Sato Nenba Village and cozy stays.
Dog-Friendly Tips: Almost all these locations welcome leashed dogs!

ğŸ•’ Timestamps:
0:00 Intro & The "Slow Life" Route
0:48 Saruhashi Bridge (Quiet River Views)
4:03 Shiraito Waterfall (Fujiyoshida Hidden Gem)
7:15 Red Leaves Light-Up (Magical Evenings)
10:15 Tenku no Torii (Peaceful Fuji View)
12:12 Momiji Corridor (Forest Stroll)
14:55 Minami Inaga Lake (Swans & Serene Scenery)
20:57 Saiko Iyashi-no-Sato (Historic Village)
ğŸ‘‡ Letâ€™s Chat!
Which of these spots would be first on your list? A quiet lake morning or the historic village? Let me know in the comments!

title: Le temps passe trop vite ğŸ˜“ #shorts #cyprien #Ã©cole #nostalgie
Day Trip from Tokyo â€” FUJINOMIYA: Shiraito Falls, Fujisan Sengen Shrine, yakisoba and more #Japan
description:
#japan #daytrip #fujinomiya

This August I decided to climb Mount Fuji for the 4th time. But I came to Fujinomiya the day before the climb and tried to visit the most popular and interesting places. I bought a ticket for GORIKI-kun (å¼·åŠ›ãã‚“) â€” Fujinomiya City Routine Sightseeing Bus (afternoon course) which is available on weekends and holidays. And in one day I managed to visit the Mt. Fuji World Heritage Centre, Shiraito Falls, Lake Tanuki, Hitoana Fuji-ko Iseki, Fuji Milk Land, Takasago Brewery, Fujisan Hongu Sengen Taisha. I also ate yakisoba (traditional local food) and chilled in Hana-no-yu onsen. And I even witnessed a local festival on the central street! It was a very interesting and busy day. I hope you'll like this video.

About Property:
~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
Hello and welcome! Today, we're exploring the delightful Hotel KAN-RAKU Fujisan Gotemba, a fantastic 3-star hotel in the charming city of Gotemba, Japan. For easy booking, you can scan the QR code on the screen or find a link in the description. Built in 2019, this hotel offers a modern experience with a warm, welcoming atmosphere. It's perfectly situated, just 1.2 kilometers from the city center, giving you easy access to everything Gotemba has to offer. Check-in starts at 3:00 PM, allowing you plenty of time to relax and settle in after your travels. The hotel boasts 91 well-appointed rooms, each thoughtfully designed with your comfort in mind. Whether you're traveling solo, as a couple, or with family and friends, you'll find a room that suits your needs. You can enjoy a relaxing breakfast each morning, and stay connected with complimentary Wi-Fi available throughout the hotel. Checking out is until 10:00 AM, giving you ample time to prepare for your departure. Please note that while children are welcome, extra charges may apply. At Hotel KAN-RAKU Fujisan Gotemba, we're dedicated to making your stay both comfortable and convenient. For a memorable stay in Gotemba, remember to scan the QR code to book your room at Hotel KAN-RAKU Fujisan Gotemba now!

Sur les cibles commerciales, le jeu a rassemblÃ© 36Â % des femmes responsables des achats de moins de cinquante ans, ainsi que 40Â % des 15/34 ans et 49Â % des 15/24 ans.

TF1 reste nÃ©anmoins en tÃªte des audiences, devanÃ§ant largement les aventures de Vincent dans lâ€™Ã©mission Tout le monde veut prendre sa place sur France 2. title: Jâ€™ai transformÃ© StÃ©phane Bern en personnage de jeu vidÃ©o
Mount Fuji From Airplane | Fujisan å¯Œå£«å±±, Japanâ€™s Active Volcano
description:
This video shows the breathtaking view of Mount Fuji (Fujisan, å¯Œå£«å±±) from above the clouds. Rising 3,776 meters, it is Japanâ€™s tallest peak and also an active stratovolcano, located near Tokyo.

Mount Fuji has long been revered as a sacred mountain and a symbol of Japan. Its perfect cone has inspired countless works of art and poetry, from ancient traditions to Hokusaiâ€™s famous woodblock prints. In 2013, it was recognized as a UNESCO World Heritage site for its cultural and artistic importance.

Seen from an airplane, the sight of this active volcano is both powerful and unforgettable, reminding us of its natural force and timeless beauty.

ã€Titleã€‘
Narusawa Ice Cave Exploration | Ancient Lava Cavern Formed by 864 AD Mt. Fuji Eruption

ã€Descriptionã€‘
Exploring Narusawa Ice Cave, a designated Japanese National Natural Monument located at Mount Fuji's base. This vertical lava cavern was formed approximately 1,150 years ago when Mount Fuji's subsidiary volcano, Nagao-san, erupted in 864 CE. The 153-meter circular tunnel descends 21 meters underground, maintaining year-round temperatures of 0-3Â°C.

The exploration captures the adventure of descending steep stairs, navigating a 91-cm-high tunnel (passing through fossilized wood from 1,100+ years ago), discovering the mysterious "Hell Hole" of unknown depth, and witnessing natural ice formations visible from winter through early summer. This cavern historically served as an ice storage facility during the Edo and Taisho periods. The video documents the otherworldly atmosphere of this geologically significant natural wonder.



ã€About Narusawa Ice Caveã€‘
Narusawa Ice Cave is a designated Japanese National Natural Monument located in Narusawa Village, Yamanashi Prefecture, officially designated December 17, 1929. This vertical lava cavern was formed during the eruption of Mount Fuji's subsidiary volcano Nagao-san in 864 CE (Jogan 6). During the lava cooling process, high-temperature internal gases and incompletely cooled lava escaped, creating the hollow cavity. The cavern is positioned at approximately 1,025 meters elevation at the eastern entrance of the Aokigahara Jukai forest.

The cavern features a vertical circular structure measuring approximately 153 meters total length, 1.5-11 meters wide, and 1-3.6 meters high. Internal temperatures remain constant at 0-3Â°C year-round. Historically, this natural refrigerator preserved gifts for the Edo period shogunate and stored ice for the Taisho period's early mechanical refrigerators.

ã€Key Attractions and Featuresã€‘
â‘ Steep Staircase Descent: The initial descent includes 91 downward steps and 101 upward return steps. Visitors experience dramatic temperature shiftsâ€”descending from 30Â°C surface temperature into progressively colder air with each step.

title: ğŸ‡¯ğŸ‡µ Morning cycling near Mount Fuji #japan #fujisan
description:
Early morning in Kawaguchiko, Japan. The air was cold and crisp. Mount Fuji stood majestically against the dawn sky. While cycling through the narrow roads, I crossed paths with a local elder on his morning walk. A simple nod. Mutual respect. Two people from different generations, different cultures, different worldsâ€”sharing the same mountain, the same sacred morning.
This is what solo travel is really about. Not finding answers, but finding permission to feel. To exist in the presence of something greater. To be acknowledged by a stranger with simple human respect.
Sometimes the most profound travel moments happen in silence.

ğŸ“ Location: Kawaguchiko, Yamanashi, Japan
ğŸš´ Solo cycling through Japan
ğŸ—» Mount Fuji views

 Currently: Singapore to Japan ğŸ‡¯ğŸ‡µ

title: (Bande Annonce) Fujisan no Kaze - Le vent du mont Fuji
description:
DÃ©couvrez le film de cette aventure sur https://www.fujisannokaze.com

RÃ©alisateur : StÃ©phane Schittek â€“ KOUA
Production : ASSOCIATION NO DIFFERENCE, KOUA PROD
Photographe : Aldo Viola

Film documentaire qui raconte lâ€™exploit exceptionnel de Lucie Retail, une femme quadri-amputÃ©e ayant atteint le sommet du mont Fuji en juillet 2025.

Le rÃ©alisateur a suivi Lucie et son entraÃ®neur Claudio Alessi durant un an dans leur prÃ©paration minutieuse, tant physique que mentale.

Lucie, malgrÃ© de fortes contraintes et ses limitations physiques apparentes, a su surmonter les obstacles pour atteindre son objectif hors normes fixÃ© Ã  3776 mÃ¨tres dâ€™altitude, le 4 juillet 2025. 

AccompagnÃ©e sur le terrain par Claudio Alessi, cofondateur de lâ€™association No Difference, elle est devenue en 2025 la premiÃ¨re personne quadri-amputÃ©e Ã  atteindre le sommet du mont Fuji.

Cette aventure restera une source dâ€™inspiration pour tous ceux qui croient en leurs rÃªves et qui sont prÃªts Ã  se battre pour les rÃ©aliser en cassant leurs propres limites.

Â« Je ne monte pas sur une montagne
pour prouver quelque chose.
Je monte pour comprendre ce que je suis.
Et ce que je peux encore devenir. Â»

First-Time Sea of Trees Walk! Aokigahara Forest Trail from Saiko Yacho-no-Mori Park | Moss Landscape & Primeval Forestã€45-Minute Beginner Hikeã€‘

ã€Descriptionã€‘
ã€Video Overviewã€‘

I attempted a beginner-friendly walk through Aokigahara Jukai (Sea of Trees) at the foot of Mount Fuji!
Starting from Saiko Yacho-no-Mori Park, this is approximately 45 minutes of nature immersion surrounded by primeval forest.
Walking through the well-maintained Jukai forest trail, I experienced stunning moss landscapes, mountain views,
and the full magic of the Aokigahara forest. This route is perfect for first-time visitors!

ã€Visited Spotsã€‘
âœ… Saiko Yacho-no-Mori Park (Starting Point)
âœ… Jukai Gallery (Museum Exhibits & Bird Information)
âœ… Maruki-bune Boat Display Hall (Lake Saiko History)
âœ… Jukai Walking Trail (Mixed conifer & broadleaf forest)
âœ… Yamata-no-Orochi (Ancient Twisted Cypress)
âœ… Wild Bird Watering Hole (Trail Junction)

ã€Trail Timelineã€‘
9:53 AM - Arrived at Saiko Yacho-no-Mori Park
10:00 AM - Forest walk begins
10:20 AM - Reached Wild Bird Watering Hole (Junction Point)
10:45 AM - Trail direction toward Bat Cave route

ã€About This Trailã€‘
â€¢ Duration: ~45 minutes (one-way walk)
â€¢ Difficulty: Beginner Level (suitable for all ages)
â€¢ Highlights: Primeval forest, moss landscapes, Mount Fuji views
â€¢ Access: Fuji Subaru Bus to "Saiko Yacho-no-Mori Park" stop

ã€Trail Characteristicsã€‘
ğŸŒ² Well-maintained wide trail paths designed for beginner walkers
ğŸŒ² Numbered trail markers prevent getting lost
ğŸŒ² Experience both conifer (evergreen) and deciduous (broadleaf) trees
ğŸŒ² Contrary to popular myths, this is a living, vibrant forest full of life
ğŸŒ² Educational exhibits at Jukai Gallery showcase forest wildlife
ğŸŒ² Clean facilities with ample parking and restrooms

ã€Park Facilities at Yacho-no-Moriã€‘
ğŸ“ Jukai Gallery
ã€€- Taxidermy displays of local birds & animals
ã€€- Educational panels about forest ecosystem
ã€€- Hours: 9:00 AM - 5:00 PM (Closed Thursdays)

ğŸ“ Birdwatching Room
ã€€- Telescopes for bird observation
ã€€- Approximately 210 bird species visit this location

ğŸ“ Craft Workshop
ã€€- Traditional woodcraft experience (reservation required)

ğŸ“ Spacious Grass Square
ã€€- Mount Fuji viewing platform
ã€€- Ideal for picnics & photography

ã€About Aokigahara Jukaiã€‘
ğŸŒ³ Formed ~1,000 years ago on Mount Fuji's ancient lava flows
ğŸŒ³ Forest area: ~3,000 hectares (approximately 23x larger than Yoyogi Park)
ğŸŒ³ Primary tree species: Hinoki cypress, hemlock, and fir
ğŸŒ³ Dense moss coverage creates a surreal, otherworldly landscape
ğŸŒ³ Officially maintained trails ensure safe, easy walking

ã€What to Bring & Wearã€‘
âš  Light Jacket: Forest stays cool even during daytime
âš  Sturdy Hiking Shoes: Uneven terrain with exposed roots & steps
âš  Insect Repellent: Particularly in warm seasons
âš  Hat: Limited sunlight inside dense forest canopy
âš  Water Bottle: Limited drinking water stations along trail

ã€Access Informationã€‘
ğŸ“ How to Get There
- From Kawaguchiko Station, take Retro Bus "Saiko & Aokigahara Line" (~40 minutes)
- Get off at "Saiko Yacho-no-Mori Park" stop

ğŸ“ Parking
- ~40 spaces available
- FREE

ğŸ“ Operating Hours
- Park: Open year-round
- Jukai Gallery: 9:00 AM - 5:00 PM (Closed Thursdays)

ã€Reference Linksã€‘
Saiko Nature Center:
https://www.vill.fujikawaguchiko.lg.jp/

Video filmed January 2026.
A perfect introduction for first-time Aokigahara visitors!

ã€Hashtagsã€‘

ã€Titleã€‘
Saiko Yacho-no-Mori Park (Wild Bird Forest Park) â€“ Winter Stroll & Saiko Ice Festival 2026ã€Japanã€‘

ã€Hashtagsã€‘
#SaikoYachoNoMoriPark #MountFuji #ParkWalk #JukaigalleryMuseum #SaikoIceFestival #FujiGawaguchiko #WinterFuji #NaturePark #FujiFiveLakes #BeginnerFriendly #Yamanashi #NatureExploration #MountFujiBase #IceArt #WinterLandscape

ã€Descriptionã€‘
ã€Video Overviewã€‘

A scenic walking tour of Saiko Yacho-no-Mori Park (Wild Bird Forest Park) at the foot of Mount Fuji!
Surrounded by the Aokigahara Jukai forest, this park features a museum gallery with exhibits,
open grasslands with Mount Fuji views, and a traditional boat display hall.
Filmed in late January, this video captures the enchanting "Saiko Ice Festival" season,
where ice sculptures create a magical winter landscape against the backdrop of Mount Fuji.

ã€Park Highlightsã€‘
âœ… Nestled within the Aokigahara Jukai forest ecosystem
âœ… Stunning Mount Fuji panoramic views
âœ… Seasonal attractions (winter features the ice art festival)
âœ… Bird watching room for amateur birders
âœ… Family-friendly facilities throughout
âœ… Free parking & restrooms available

ã€Facilities Overviewã€‘
ğŸ“ Jukai Gallery
ã€€- Taxidermy displays of local birds & animals
ã€€- Educational exhibits on Saiko's ecosystem
ã€€- Hours: 9:00 AM - 5:00 PM (Closed Thursdays)

ğŸ“ Maruki-bune Boat Display Hall
ã€€- Historical exhibits on Lake Saiko culture & fishing
ã€€- Learn about post-war maritime heritage

ğŸ“ Birdwatching Room
ã€€- Telescopes & binoculars for bird observation
ã€€- Different species visit by season

ğŸ“ Grass Square
ã€€- Mount Fuji panoramic viewing platform
ã€€- Perfect for picnics & photography
ã€€- Winter venue for the ice festival

ğŸ“ Craft Workshop
ã€€- Traditional woodcraft experience (reservation required)
ã€€- Family-friendly hands-on activities

ã€2026 Saiko Koori Matsuri (Ice Festival)ã€‘
ğŸ¨ Dates: January 31 (Sat) â€“ February 11 (Wed), 2026
ğŸ¨ Illumination: Sunset to 7:00 PM (19:00)
ğŸ¨ Venue: Saiko Yacho-no-Mori Park
ğŸ¨ Admission: FREE
ğŸ¨ Parking: FREE (~40 spaces)

ğŸ“‹ Festival Highlights
- Breathtaking frost-covered trees (some 5 meters / 16 feet tall)
- Nighttime illumination creates otherworldly beauty
- Ice sculptures framed by snowy Mount Fuji
- Crisp winter air ideal for photography
- Nature's masterpiece formed by Mount Fuji's sub-freezing climate

ğŸ“‹ How to Experience the Festival
- Daytime: Marvel at the towering ice formations
- Dusk to Night: Capture glowing illuminated sculptures
- Weekends & Holidays: Food stalls & stage performances
- Golden Hour: Silhouettes of ice trees against snowy peaks

ã€Access Informationã€‘
ğŸ“ Address: 2068 Saiko, Fujikawaguchiko-machi, Minobu-line, Yamanashi Prefecture

ğŸ“ Train & Bus Access
- Fuji Subaru Line to "Kawaguchiko Station"
- Board Retro Bus "Saiko & Aokigahara Green Line" (~40 minutes)
- Get off at "Saiko Yacho-no-Mori Park" stop (direct arrival)

ğŸ“ Driving Access
- Central Expressway "Kawaguchiko" IC â†’ Head toward Saiko (~30 minutes)

ğŸ“ Parking
- ~40 spaces available (FREE)

ğŸ“ Operating Hours
- Park: Open year-round
- Jukai Gallery: 9:00 AM - 5:00 PM (Closed Thursdays)

title: Fujisan, Gunung yang menjadi ikon negara Jepang. #daftarstory #fujisan #shortsvideo
description:
Gunung Fuji adalah gunung berapi aktif ikonik di Jepang yang tingginya (3.776) MDPL dan merupakan simbol nasional serta Situs Warisan Dunia UNESCO. 

Gunung ini terkenal dengan bentuk kerucutnya yang simetris, tertutup salju selama lebih dari lima bulan, dan dikelilingi oleh lima danau indah, yaitu Danau Kawaguchi, Yamanaka, Sai, Motosu, dan ShÅji. 

Sebagai situs budaya yang suci, Gunung Fuji telah menjadi inspirasi bagi seniman dan penyair serta tujuan ziarah selama berabad-abad.Â

A very busy day with Brompton.

After a nice photo shot of Mt. Fuji and my Brompton at 1300m altitude, having a hot meal at Tenkachaya, a historic lodge at Mikasa pass, then I climbed and reached the summit of Mt. Mikasa, at the elevation of 1596m.

ã€è‹±èªç‰ˆã€‘

ã€Titleã€‘
Koyodai Viewpoint & Tokai Nature Trail | Quiet Forest Hike at the Foot of Mt. Fuji

ã€Descriptionã€‘
This video captures a relaxed hike around Koyodai Viewpoint and along a short section of the Tokai Nature Trail near Mt. Fuji. From the Koyodai area (around 1,164 m elevation), you can enjoy an open view of Mt. Fuji rising in front of you, together with surrounding ridgelines. It is not a dramatic summit climb, but rather a calm mountain walk with simple viewpoints and forest paths.

The footage focuses on two main parts: walking around the Koyodai viewpoint area near the rest house, and then following a forested section of the Tokai Nature Trail. Viewers can experience the feel of walking on natural dirt trails, stepping over tree roots, and hearing each footstep on fallen leaves. This video is especially suitable for those who enjoy the quiet atmosphere of casual hiking rather than visiting major tourist spots.

ã€Visited Spotsã€‘
Koyodai parking area â†’ Koyodai Viewpoint / rest house area â†’ Viewpoint zone â†’ Tokai Nature Trail (mountain path section)

ã€Trail Characteristicsã€‘
- Elevation: Around 1,164 m  
- Route Type: Short section of the Tokai Nature Trail around Koyodai (forest mountain path)  
- Difficulty: Easy to Easy-Intermediate (good for beginners who are used to walking on mountain trails)  
- Time: About 1â€“2 hours total for the viewpoint area plus a short out-and-back on the trail  
- Atmosphere: Quiet forest hike surrounded by trees, away from busy sightseeing spots

ã€Accessã€‘
- Location: Narusawa area, Yamanashi Prefecture, Japan  
- By Car: About 20 minutes from Kawaguchiko Station; drive along Route 139 toward Lake Motosu and follow signs toward Koyodai  
- By Bus: From Kawaguchiko Station, take a local bus and get off at â€œKoyodai Iriguchiâ€; then hike up the mountain path to Koyodai  
- Parking: Limited parking space near Koyodai Viewpoint Rest House (check availability in advance)

ã€What to Bring & Wearã€‘
- Sturdy hiking or trekking shoes (uneven terrain, roots, small steps)  
- Comfortable clothing plus a light jacket (cool temperatures and wind at higher elevation)  
- Water (few places to buy drinks along the way)  
- Hat and sunscreen (sun can be strong on clear days)  
- Rain gear (mountain weather can change quickly)  
- Camera or smartphone (be mindful not to block the trail with tripods)

ã€Good Shots for Videoã€‘
- Mt. Fuji seen from the Koyodai viewpoint area  
- Close-up shots of the dirt trail, roots, and fallen leaves  
- Walking POV shots that capture the rhythm of footsteps and forest sounds  
- Seasonal changes in the trees (fresh green, deep summer green, autumn colors, winter trees)

ã€Safety Notesã€‘
- Trails may become slippery in rain or snowâ€”avoid pushing too hard in bad conditions  
- Hiking shoes are safer than regular sneakers on uneven ground  
- If hiking alone, let someone know your route and expected return time  
- Please carry out all trash and respect the mountain environment

Video filmed in January 2026. Enjoy the peaceful atmosphere of Koyodai and the Tokai Nature Trail at the foot of Mt. Fuji.

ã€Hashtagsã€‘

About Property:

Welcome to the FUJISAN MISHIMA TOKYU HOTEL, your perfect base for exploring the region! To book your stay, simply scan the QR code displayed on screen or check the description below. This hotel is designed to make your stay as comfortable and convenient as possible. Stay connected with complimentary Wi-Fi throughout the property, ensuring you can easily share your experiences and stay in touch. For those arriving by car, the hotel offers on-site parking. Laundry services are also available, with the dry cleaning service taking care of your wardrobe so you can pack lighter. For the convenience of all guests, smoking is restricted to designated areas. Guest rooms have been thoughtfully equipped with your comfort in mind. Certain rooms offer amenities like air conditioning, blackout curtains, and linen services. You'll also find some rooms equipped with a refrigerator, bottled water, and instant tea for your refreshment. Select rooms also feature a hairdryer and complimentary toiletries. Start your day right with the hotel's on-site breakfast. You can also enjoy convenient dining options at the hotel restaurants. For relaxation and wellness, take advantage of the steam room and sauna. If you're looking to stay active, the hotel's fitness facility is available to keep you refreshed and healthy. Plus, your stay includes breakfast and dinner! Don't forget to scan the QR code again to book your unforgettable stay at the FUJISAN MISHIMA TOKYU HOTEL!

Japanese plum "kiyou" from Minami Alps City, Yamanashi Prefecture ,Japanâ—ï¸

The dark red plum (Japanese Plum) brilliantly overturned the values of plums so far. There is a good balance of sweetness and sourness, and this sourness complements the sweetness and gives depth to the taste. The refreshing feeling after eating is the freshness unique to Japanese Prum"kiyou".

title: Mount Fuji Behind a Waterfall?! Japan Vlog at Shiraito Falls
description:
Exploring Mount Fujiâ€™s hidden waterfall at Shiraito Falls during winter led to one of my favorite views in Japan. Want my Google Maps links? Join my free travel email list for tips and updates! https://www.alextravelsfar.com/home/#jumprope 

ğŸ’¬ Want personalized travel advice? Book a 1:1 Travel Talk Session with me! https://www.alextravelsfar.com/contact 

ğŸ“² CONNECT WITH ME!
Instagram https://www.instagram.com/alextravelsfarvlogs/
TikTok: https://www.tiktok.com/@alextravelsfarvlogs
Patreon: https://www.patreon.com/AlexTravelsFar

TIMECODES:
00:00 â€“ Hidden Mount Fuji Waterfall
00:33 â€“ Snowy Morning Near Mount Fuji
02:08 â€“ Drive to Shiraito Falls
03:14 â€“ Finding Shiraito Falls
06:30 â€“ Mount Fuji + Waterfall View
09:30 â€“ Forest Waterfall Trail
12:11 â€“ Best View at Shiraito Falls
14:07 â€“ Leaving Shiraito Falls
15:22 â€“ Getting Gas in Japan
21:38 â€“ 7-Eleven Dinner in Japan
22:40 â€“ Outro

In This Video:
I drove through snowy roads near Mount Fuji to find a hidden waterfall at Shiraito Fallsâ€”and it was unreal.

This Japan travel vlog takes you deep into the Mount Fuji region to explore Shiraito Falls, one of the most beautiful and underrated waterfalls in Japan. With snow on the ground, quiet forest trails, and almost no crowds, this turned into one of my favorite Mount Fuji days.

I compare two different Shiraito Falls locations (yes, there are two with the same name), hike the full loop trail, and hunt for the perfect spot where Mount Fuji and a waterfall appear in the same frame. Along the way, youâ€™ll see scenic winter driving, peaceful forest paths, and multiple waterfall viewpoints.

After leaving Shiraito Falls, the adventure doesnâ€™t stop. I navigate a rural Japanese gas station for the first time and end the day with a surprisingly great 7-Eleven dinner in Japan, proving once again why Japanese convenience stores are in a league of their own.

If youâ€™re planning a Mount Fuji road trip, winter travel in Japan, or looking for hidden gems beyond the usual tourist spots, this video is for you.

title: How Fujisan Hongu Sengen Taisha Survived for 2,000 Years | UNESCO World Heritage site
description:
How Fujisan Hongu Sengen Taisha Survived for 2,000 Years | UNESCO World Heritage site

Join us on an unforgettable Fujisan Hongu Sengen Taisha shrine tour as we uncover the Mount Fuji sacred shrine secrets! Discover the hidden history of Fuji shrine, from its legendary founding over 2,000 years ago to its role as a UNESCO World Heritage site. Witness the thrilling Sengen Taisha fire festival 2024 and learn about the mysterious rituals at Sengen Taisha that have been practiced for centuries. Did you know this shrine is considered one of Japanâ€™s most powerful shrines?

ğŸŒ¸ Cherry blossoms at Sengen Shrine create a magical atmosphere, while the iconic torii gate near Mount Fuji offers some of the best views of Mt. Fuji shrine. Dive into the legacy of Tokugawa Ieyasu and Fuji worship, and explore why this sacred site remains a must-visit. title: ğŸ‡¯ğŸ‡µ Away from the chaos #japan #fujisan #fypã‚·
description:
I came here with my bicycle. Found this place just near the Kawaguchiko Ohashi Bridge and just... stopped.
Sleeping on the stones. Standing and gazing at Fuji. Sitting in silence with my bike beside me. No agenda. No schedule. Just me and the mountain.
Back in Singapore, life is loud. Questions pile up. Decisions wait. The noise never really stops.
But here? By Lake Kawaguchiko, with Mount Fuji standing eternal in front of me â€“ the chaos feels a world away.
I needed this. To sit. To breathe. To sleep on rocks and not care about comfort. To stare at a mountain and let it remind me how small my problems actually are.
Sometimes you don't need answers. You just need distance. Space. A bicycle ride to somewhere quiet where you can think without the world demanding something from you.
Away from the chaos.

ğŸ‡®ğŸ‡³ Indian solo traveler exploring the world ğŸŒ
 Currently: Singapore to Japan ğŸ‡¯ğŸ‡µ

title: 86 the Map: Exploring the Enchanting Lakes & FujiSan: A Ride Through Japan's Majesty
description:
Take a ride with me around FujiSan and it's 5 Lakes || Chef Michellee Fox

Most visitors to Japan rush through Tokyo, Osaka, Kyoto â€” but the true soul of Japan lives quietly beyond the cities. In this video, we wandered around the Fuji Five Lakes (å¯Œå£«äº”æ¹–, Fujigoko), a chain of breathtaking lakes formed by ancient eruptions from Mt. Fuji: Lake Kawaguchi, Lake Motosu, Lake Saiko, Lake Shoji, and Lake Yamanaka. Each one with its own personality, all carrying the silent, timeless presence of Fuji watching overhead.

At a tiny roadside stall, we met a grandmother making oyaki â€” a traditional Japanese dumpling stuffed with sweet or savory fillings like miso, vegetables, or red bean paste. A humble food, born from tough winters and no-waste values. Eating it fresh and warm in the cold morning was unforgettable.

Along the way, colorful koinobori (carp streamers) danced in the sky â€” a symbol of strength and perseverance for Children's Day (Kodomo no Hi). In Japan, the carpâ€™s struggle upstream is a metaphor for overcoming hardships, a reminder that resilience is beautiful.

This place reminds you: nature doesnâ€™t rush. Mountains donâ€™t scream for attention. Beauty just is.Slow down. Look around. There's a different kind of magic out here.

S U B S C R I B E so that we can be together for a long time!! Thank you so much for watching!

title: MOUNT FUJI TRAIN VIEW - Super lucky POV of Fujisan! #japanlife #mountfuji #japantrip #japanvlog
description:
Apparently you have to be super lucky to be able to see Fuji-san on the Shinkansen, so praise be the Buddha, that we were able to see #mtfuji ğŸ¤©

Shinkansen Tip - if you are booking from Kyoto  Tokyo, book seats on the LEFT side of the train for the potential to see Fuji! No guarantees and ive even heard of people not being able to see on super sunny days ğŸ˜­ but good luck!!!

Honestly, just seeing the scale of it from so close (but so far) is mesmerising! I missed the season to climb it but ive heard climbing other mountains in Japan is better as you can then view fuji in the background

title: Le livre qui manque Ã  ta bibliothÃ¨que ğŸ“š
these months tend to have clearer skies #fujisan #japantravel
Mount Fujisan â€” Japanâ€™s Sacred Sleeping Volcano
description:
Mount Fujisan isnâ€™t just Japanâ€™s tallest mountain â€”itâ€™s a national symbol, and a volcano with a surprisingly dramatic past.

Most people see a single peak, but Fujisan is actually three volcanoes stacked on top of each other, shaped by repeated eruptions over thousands of years â€” and surrounded by five lakes, forests, and hot springs created by its own volcanic eruptions.

Rising 3,776 metres, Mount Fujisan is a perfectly symmetrical stratovolcano, visible from Tokyo on clear days nearly 100 kilometres away.

For over 1,000 years, Fujisan has been considered sacred, worshipped by Shinto and Buddhist monks, poets, and pilgrims who believed that climbing the mountain brought spiritual purification and rebirth.

Its last eruption occurred in 1707, known as the HÅei Eruption.Lava stayed close to the mountain, but volcanic ash fell across central Japan, reaching Edo â€” modern-day Tokyo.

That eruption reshaped Fujisan, leaving behind a new crater still visible today.
Since then, Fujisan has been quiet â€” but not extinct.

Scientists classify it as active, and small earthquakes beneath the mountain are a reminder that Fujisan is still alive.

Fujisan is also famous for something unexpected.
Every summer, over 300,000 people climb to the summit, where the sunrise is known as GoraikÅ â€” â€œthe arrival of light.â€

In 2013, Mount Fujisan was declared a UNESCO World Heritage Site, not for geology â€” but for its profound cultural and spiritual influence.

Mount Fujisan isnâ€™t just a volcano â€”itâ€™s Japanâ€™s spirit, shaped by fire and revered for centuries.

Would you dare to climb this sleeping giant?

title: Climbing Mount Fuji in 2025 ğŸ‡¯ğŸ‡µ (Yoshida Trail)
description:
In this video, we climb Japanâ€™s highest and most iconic mountain - Mount Fuji (å¯Œå£«å±±) - via the Yoshida Trail, starting from the 5th Station. Located on the Yamanashi side, this is the most popular and accessible route to the summit, with mountain huts, rest stops, and well-marked trails along the way.

The hike begins at the Fuji-Subaru Line 5th Station, situated at around 2,300 metres above sea level. From there, we make the long ascent through volcanic terrain, reaching the summit of Yoshidaguchi Peak at 3,710 metres (the highest peak is Kengamine at 3,775.6m which was closed at the time of recording). After soaking in the views, we descend back to the 5th Station and return by bus to Mount Fuji Station.

Further information about climbing Mount Fuji can be found at the following website:

https://www.fujisan-climb.jp/en/

Mount Fuji Map App - https://www.yamareco.com/mtfuji/en/

The places we visit in the video and their locations include:

- Lake Kawaguchi - https://maps.app.goo.gl/sd1uPpDgJKgfz2VQA

- Mount Fuji Station - https://maps.app.goo.gl/weYCgDsKbT1Xdgyg8

- Fuji-Subaru Line 5th Station - https://maps.app.goo.gl/qkyU77uYpt7grEvG7

- Yoshida Trail 5th Station - https://maps.app.goo.gl/9aS5qWjtkN4hfqnCA

- Mount Fuji - https://maps.app.goo.gl/9sCexK1eusBPMRip8

Date of filming: Thursday, 3rd of July 2025
Camera: DJI Osmo Action Pro 5

title: What itâ€™s really like to car camp at Mt.Fuji in winterå¯Œå£«å±±è‡ªé©¾è½¦éœ²è¥
description:
Is a Jimny road trip worth it? We rented this 4WD with a rooftop tent for 4 days/3 nights. In this video, we break down our Day 1 experience at our first campground and the reality of winter camping as Malaysians. If we could redo this trip, weâ€™d do it completely differently. Here is the unfiltered guide to planning your own Mt. Fuji adventure :

â€¢ ğŸ’° Total costs for 4 Days 3 Nights Car & Campsite Rental, Train, Food, Tolls, Insurance: USD820/RM3,500/Â¥127,000 
â€¢ ğŸ—ºï¸ Our Day 1 Jimny Japan itinerary and break down cost is listed in full video.

Official Website: https://cloud9camping.jp/

ã€è‹±èªç‰ˆã€‘

ã€Titleã€‘
Dragon Palace Cave (Ryugu Doketsu) - Sacred Power Spot Hidden in Aokigahara Jukai Forestã€Mount Fuji Baseã€‘

ã€Descriptionã€‘
Exploring Dragon Palace Cave, a mystical lava cavern hidden deep within Aokigahara Jukai forest at Mount Fuji's base. This natural monument features a sacred shrine 60 meters underground, whispered about in ancient Japanese legends where the goddess Toyotama-hime emerged from Dragon Palace riding upon a dragon.

ã€Visited Spotã€‘
Dragon Palace Cave (cave entrance â†’ interior â†’ shrine grounds)

ã€About Dragon Palace Caveã€‘
Dragon Palace Cave is a naturally-formed lava tunnel approximately 60 meters deep, shaped by Mount Fuji's ancient lava flows. Designated as a National Natural Monument, this mystical cavern is surrounded by the Aokigahara Jukai forest. Inside the cave, a small shrine dedicated to "Senoumi Shrine" honors the legend of Toyotama-hime from Japanese mythology. The cave maintains cool temperatures year-round, and visitors often witness mysterious white mist at the entranceâ€”believed by locals to be dragons, though scientists attribute it to temperature gradients.

ã€Cave Interior Featuresã€‘
The cave interior is covered in lush moss, creating an otherworldly atmosphere. Stone steps lead visitors down from the entrance toward the sacred shrine. Even in daylight, the cave remains dimâ€”a flashlight greatly enhances visibility and safety. The mysterious white mist that sometimes envelops the entrance is photographically stunning and represents one of Japan's most atmospheric spiritual sites.

ã€Why It Remains Hiddenã€‘
Access to Dragon Palace Cave requires hiking through the Aokigahara forest and branching onto smaller trails. It's deliberately absent from mainstream tourist routes, maintaining its status as a true power spot known mainly to dedicated explorers. The combination of approximately 1,000-year-old primeval forest and ancient cave legends creates a uniquely sacred and mysterious location.

ã€The Legend Behind the Power Spotã€‘
Toyotama-hime is a goddess in Japanese mythologyâ€”daughter of the sea god and princess of Dragon Palace (Ryugu). According to local legend, the goddess appeared at Dragon Palace Cave riding a dragon. The unexplained white mist occasionally veiling the cave entrance is said to mark dragon appearances. While naturally caused by temperature differences between cave and atmosphere, this mysterious phenomenon continues attracting pilgrims and spiritual seekers.

ã€Facility Informationã€‘
Dragon Palace Cave: Free admission (open year-round) | Hours: Always accessible | Parking: Forest area parking spaces available

ã€Access Informationã€‘
Address: Lake Saiko area, Fujikawaguchiko-machi, Minamitsuru-gun, Yamanashi Prefecture | Train & Bus: From Kawaguchiko Station, board Fuji Subaru "Saiko Circular Bus" (~35-40 min), then hike ~20-30 minutes from trail junctions | By Car: From Kawaguchiko IC on Central Expressway toward Saiko (~30 minutes)

ã€What to Bring & Wearã€‘
Warm clothing (caves are extremely cold), flashlight (cave interior is dark), sturdy hiking shoes (steps & slippery surfaces), insect repellent, hat, water bottle, camera

ã€Photography Spotsã€‘
Cave entrance, underground stone staircase, shrine area, mysterious white mist formations, forest-surrounded cave landscape, moss-covered rock formations

title: L'Ã‰popÃ©e des Hommes de Mer
description:

Une terre de glace, de fer et de promesses.

Sur le sable sacrÃ© de Lindisfarne.

Mais ils allaient trouver l'oubli dans l'intÃ©gration.

(Couplet 1)
Huit juin, sept cent quatre-vingt-treize, lâ€™aube se lÃ¨ve en sang,

Venus de SuÃ¨de, de NorvÃ¨ge et des cÃ´tes du Danemark,

Ã‰coutez dans le vent, le rÃ©cit de leur dernier voyage.

(Couplet 2)
Huit cent cinquante-neuf, lâ€™horizon sâ€™Ã©largit encore,
La Frise et le Brabant voient s'abattre le sort.
Lâ€™Escaut et la Somme tremblent sous leurs rames d'acier,
Mais le Nord ne suffit plus Ã  leur soif de guerroyer.
Ils contournent lâ€™Espagne, franchissent les colonnes dâ€™Hercule,
Entrent en MÃ©diterranÃ©e quand le soleil bascule,
Et remontant le RhÃ´ne, au cÅ“ur des terres franques,
Ils pillent les citÃ©s, comblant tout ce qui leur manque.

(Pont)
Mais le monde change, les royaumes s'organisent,
Les Ã‰tats-nations naissent, les frontiÃ¨res se prÃ©cisent.
La foi nouvelle s'installe, les Ã©glises remplacent les autels,
L'intÃ©gration commence, les guerriers deviennent mortels.

(Couplet 3)
Mille soixante-six, le glas sonne sur les plaines d'Angleterre,
L'invasion normande achÃ¨ve une Ã¨re de mystÃ¨re.
ConcurrencÃ©s par les marchands, fondus dans les citÃ©s,
Les fils de Thor s'effacent, perdant leur identitÃ©.
L'extinction arrive, non par le fer, mais par le temps,
Les royaumes scandinaves deviennent des enfants du prÃ©sent.

(Refrain)
Vikings du Nord, guerriers de lâ€™ombre et de la lumiÃ¨re,
Navigateurs sans peur, rois de la terre et de la mer.
De lâ€™Odin au Christ, le destin change de visage,
Ã‰coutez dans le vent, le rÃ©cit de leur dernier voyage.

(Outro)
Leurs noms sont dans la terre, leur sang dans nos veines,
Lâ€™Ã©popÃ©e sâ€™est Ã©teinte, mais la lÃ©gende demeure souveraine.
De la SuÃ¨de Ã  la mer, le silence a tout repris...
Adieu les hommes du Nord, de l'an mille soixante-six.

(Couplet 4)
Ce nâ€™est pas seulement le fer qui fait plier les genoux,
Câ€™est lâ€™appel de la terre, un destin bien plus doux.
En Normandie, en Russie, ils dÃ©posent les boucliers,
Pour devenir seigneurs, paysans ou bien banquiers.
Ils ne sont plus pillards, ils deviennent bÃ¢tisseurs,
Apprenant les langues, oubliant leurs anciennes peurs.
Le commerce devient roi, la Hanse prend leur place,
La puissance des guildes efface lentement leur trace.

(Couplet 5)
Les rois du Danemark et les jarls de NorvÃ¨ge,
Troquent le marteau de Thor pour de nouveaux privilÃ¨ges.
Les Ã‰tats naissants demandent l'ordre et la loi,
On ne part plus en raid sous la banniÃ¨re d'un roi.
Les comptoirs de l'Orient, la fourrure et l'ambre prÃ©cieux,

Pour ces fiers Ã©quipages dÃ©fiant l'ocÃ©an.

De lâ€™Odin au Christ, le destin change de visage,
Ã‰coutez dans le vent, le rÃ©cit de leur dernier voyage.

(Couplet 6)
Octobre mille soixante-six, le vent tourne Ã  Hastings,

Guillaume le ConquÃ©rant, fils de cette lignÃ©e,

Lâ€™Angleterre est conquise, mais lâ€™esprit sâ€™est transformÃ©,

L'intÃ©gration est faite, le sang s'est mÃ©langÃ©,
Le monde des anciens dieux s'en est allÃ©, changÃ©.

(Final)
Regardez les clochers, regardez les sillons,
Ils sont encore lÃ , dans l'ombre des nations.
De la SuÃ¨de Ã  la France, de l'Escaut au RhÃ´ne noir,

title: How to spend a day trip to Mt. Fuji from Tokyo, Japan! #mtfuji #lakekawaguchiko #fujisan #visitjapan
description:
How to spend a day trip to Mount Fuji from Tokyo, Japan! ğŸ‡¯ğŸ‡µğŸ—»

Mt. Fuji is surrounded by five lakes known as the Fuji Five Lakes. Lake Kawaguchiko is the most easily accessible out of the five lakes. Itâ€™s a hot spring resort town with various tourist attractions and breathtaking views of Mt. Fuji around the lake!

There are train and direct bus connections from Tokyo!

I ended up taking the bus from Tokyoâ€™s Shinjuku Expressway Bus Terminal! Which is about 2200 JPN ($14) one way. The bus ride is about 2 hours.
 
Youâ€™ll be hit with the beautiful sight of Mt. Fuji on a clear day right before the last stop.

Once you arrive at Kawaguchiko Station (last bus stop) explore the Kawaguchiko stations gift shop and pick up some souvenirs! Also try their tasty sweet bean cake!

As well as Japanese strawberry sponge cake & matcha latte at this little food truck called Fujiyama Cookie near the station!

Next ride the Mt. Fuji Panoramic Ropeway up to Mt. Tenjoâ€™s observation deck which offers breathtaking  views of Mt. Fuji and Lake Kawaguchiko below!

Round trip tickets costs 1000 JPY ($6) for adults and 500 JPY ($3) for kids.

Couples can also ring the Bell of Tenjo which is suspended in a heart shaped frame to keep their
relationship happy. 

Thereâ€™s also hiking trails, tons of photo ops, a rabbit shrine, & local folklore to engage in such as tale of the tanuki & rabbit also know as kachi kachi yama!

The cable car ride to the top takes about 3 minutes. You can also hike to the top which is 45 mins.

Next try some tasty cheesecake at Cheesecake Garden. Try the basque, sour cream, & asagiri kougen cheesecake which are their best sellers! 

You get a free cup of coffee for every piece of cheesecake you order. Also try their red bean buns! 

Right before you take the bus back to Tokyo, If you have room for it try Oshiruko at the Ryo from Kawaguchiko Food Truck. 

Oshiruko which is a traditional Japanese dessert made with sweet red bean soup. 

Would you visit? Have you been to Mt. Fuji?

title: [Cyprien] Cyprien's First Adventure in Korea Begins | A Journey of Culture, Creativity & Discovery
description:
Cyprien embarks on a journey through Korea - meeting artists in Seoul, uncovering history in Gyeongju, and chasing raw inspiration on the island of Ulleungdo! ğŸš²

From Ramyeon by the river to cliffside sunsets, he explores the stories, people, and moments that make Korea unlike anywhere else. âœ¨

And among these destinations, Gyeongju stands out â€” not only as a city rich with a thousand years of history, but also as the stage for APEC 2025 KOREA.

ğŸ“APEC 2025 KOREA (Asia-Pacific Economic Cooperation) is a regional economic forum comprising 21 member economies. It will be held in Gyeongju from October 27 to November 1. Gyeongju, a city with a thousand years of history, is home to numerous ancient cultural sites, including several UNESCO World Heritage Sites. Reflecting the growing economic significance of the cultural industry, this year marks the first time that cultural industries have been included as an official agenda topic at APEC.

â€‹Cyprien entame un voyage Ã  travers la CorÃ©e, entre rencontres artistiques Ã  SÃ©oul, plongÃ©e dans l'histoire Ã  Gyeongju et quÃªte d'inspiration sur l'Ã®le d'Ulleungdo ! ğŸš²

Du ramyeon dÃ©gustÃ© au bord du fleuve aux couchers de soleil spectaculaires depuis les falaises, il dÃ©couvre les rÃ©cits, les personnes et les instants qui rendent la CorÃ©e si unique. âœ¨

Parmi toutes ces destinations, Gyeongju se distingue : outre la richesse de son histoire millÃ©naire, elle accueille cette annÃ©e l'APEC 2025 KOREA.

ğŸ“APEC 2025 KOREA, L'APEC (CoopÃ©ration Ã©conomique pour l'Asie-Pacifique) est un forum Ã©conomique rÃ©gional rÃ©unissant 21 Ã©conomies membres. Il se tiendra Ã  Gyeongju du 27 octobre au 1er novembre.Gyeongju, ville millÃ©naire, abrite de nombreux sites culturels ancestraux, dont plusieurs classÃ©s au patrimoine mondial de l'UNESCO. Pour la premiÃ¨re fois, l'APEC inscrit cette annÃ©e les industries culturelles Ã  son agenda officiel, soulignant leur poids Ã©conomique croissant.

Fuji Subaru Line 5th Station, often referred to simply as the "5th Station," is one of the most popular starting points for climbing Mount Fuji. It's located about 2,300 meters (7,546 feet) above sea level and serves as a gateway for hikers and tourists. Hereâ€™s what you can typically expect there:

1. **Access**: The 5th Station can be reached by car or bus via the Subaru Line, a toll road that leads up the northern slope of Mount Fuji. It's a convenient access point for those starting their ascent or just wanting to experience the mountain without climbing to the summit.

2. **Facilities**: There are several facilities at the 5th Station, including souvenir shops, restaurants, and restrooms. You can also find places to rent hiking gear if you didnâ€™t bring your own. Thereâ€™s a small post office where you can send postcards as a unique memento.

3. **Views**: The 5th Station offers stunning views of the surrounding landscape, including the Southern Alps and Lake Yamanaka. On clear days, you can enjoy breathtaking vistas, and the cooler temperatures at this altitude provide a refreshing break from the heat of the plains below.

4. **Climbing Routes**: The 5th Station is the starting point for the Yoshida Trail, the most popular route to the summit of Mount Fuji. It takes about 6-8 hours to reach the summit from here, depending on your pace and the weather conditions.

5. **Altitude Considerations**: Because itâ€™s already at a relatively high altitude, some people might experience mild symptoms of altitude sickness. Itâ€™s a good idea to spend some time acclimatizing at the 5th Station before starting the ascent.

6. **Best Time to Visit**: The climbing season for Mount Fuji is typically from early July to early September, when the weather is most favorable and the mountain huts are open. Outside of this period, access to the summit can be dangerous due to snow and extreme weather conditions, but the 5th Station can still be visited for sightseeing.

About Property:
~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
Hey everyone, and welcome back to the channel! Today, I'm super excited to share a real hidden gem with you, a place that seriously charmed me while I was exploring Japan: The Select Inn Fujisan Gotemba! And guess what? I've got a QR code right here on the screen, so you can easily scan it for all the booking details and start planning your own amazing trip! Okay, so picture this: You're in Gotemba, right? This adorable little town nestled near Mount Fuji. And you want a place that's super close to everything, but also a total oasis of calm. That's exactly what you get at the Select Inn Fujisan Gotemba! It's located just a hop, skip, and a jump from the city center, only about half a kilometer away, so you're never far from the action. But, trust me, the moment you walk through the doors, you leave all the hustle and bustle behind. It's like stepping into a different world! The atmosphere is just... serene. The staff? Absolutely lovely. They were so welcoming and helpful, making me feel right at home. The hotel itself is a 2.5-star, which I know might not sound like much, but it's been renovated with a beautifully modern vibe that really makes a difference. The 107 rooms are cozy and really well-appointed. They have everything you need to unwind and relax after a day of sightseeing. Plus, the rooms have this amazing, soothing ambiance, which is perfect for catching up on some quality sleep! And the amenities? They completely cover the essentials. There's free Wi-Fi, perfect for staying connected and sharing all your travel pics with your friends and family. They also offer breakfast, so you can fuel up for a day of exploring everything Gotemba has to offer - and let me tell you, there's a lot to see! Plus, I really appreciated how clean and well-maintained everything was. They clearly put a lot of effort into making sure guests feel comfortable and cared for. And, if you're coming from the airport, you're looking at about a 150-minute drive, so getting there is a breeze! Honestly, whether you're traveling for business or just on a chill vacation, the Select Inn Fujisan Gotemba is a fantastic choice. It's affordable, it's comfortable, and the location is just perfect for exploring the area. So, what are you waiting for? Don't forget that QR code on the screen - scan it, check out the availability, and book your stay at the Select Inn Fujisan Gotemba! You absolutely won't regret it. Trust me! Happy travels, everyone!

Cyprien Sarrazin had a serious fall during the second downhill training session in Bormio on Friday. SKI star Cyprien Sarrazin was airlifted and taken to intensive care after suffering a horror head injury.

At the terrifying Stelvio slope, which will host the 2026 Winter Olympics, alarming scenes followed.

Sarrazin was found to have a subdural haematoma, or bleeding close to the brain, but was still awake, according to the French ski union.

The Frenchmen was airlifted to the closest medical facility and had to be brought to the hospital right away. After additional testing, it was determined to operate on Sarrazin on Friday night.
The horrible accident took place after a crash during training for a World Cup downhill race.

the 30-year-old fell violently after one of the jumps on the lower section of the course. Sarazzin was leading the training run again by more than half a second but came off the jump at an angle and flew sideways, almost landing backward on the hard-packed slope. 

He spun and tumbled and hit his head and seemingly lost consciousness, sliding motionlessly into the safety nets lower down.

Mount Fuji â€” also known as Fujiyama or Fujisan (å¯Œå£«å±±) â€” is Japanâ€™s tallest and most iconic mountain. Rising to 3,776 meters, itâ€™s more than just a stunning natural landmark. ã€è‹±èªç‰ˆã€‘

ã€Titleã€‘
Koyodai Viewpoint & Tokai Nature Trail | Quiet Forest Hike at the Foot of Mt. Fuji

ã€Descriptionã€‘
This video captures a relaxed hike around Koyodai Viewpoint and along a short section of the Tokai Nature Trail near Mt. Fuji. From the Koyodai area (around 1,164 m elevation), you can enjoy an open view of Mt. Fuji rising in front of you, together with surrounding ridgelines. It is not a dramatic summit climb, but rather a calm mountain walk with simple viewpoints and forest paths.

The footage focuses on two main parts: walking around the Koyodai viewpoint area near the rest house, and then following a forested section of the Tokai Nature Trail. Viewers can experience the feel of walking on natural dirt trails, stepping over tree roots, and hearing each footstep on fallen leaves. This video is especially suitable for those who enjoy the quiet atmosphere of casual hiking rather than visiting major tourist spots.

ã€Visited Spotsã€‘
Koyodai parking area â†’ Koyodai Viewpoint / rest house area â†’ Viewpoint zone â†’ Tokai Nature Trail (mountain path section)

ã€Trail Characteristicsã€‘
- Elevation: Around 1,164 m  
- Route Type: Short section of the Tokai Nature Trail around Koyodai (forest mountain path)  
- Difficulty: Easy to Easy-Intermediate (good for beginners who are used to walking on mountain trails)  
- Time: About 1â€“2 hours total for the viewpoint area plus a short out-and-back on the trail  
- Atmosphere: Quiet forest hike surrounded by trees, away from busy sightseeing spots

ã€Accessã€‘
- Location: Narusawa area, Yamanashi Prefecture, Japan  
- By Car: About 20 minutes from Kawaguchiko Station; drive along Route 139 toward Lake Motosu and follow signs toward Koyodai  
- By Bus: From Kawaguchiko Station, take a local bus and get off at â€œKoyodai Iriguchiâ€; then hike up the mountain path to Koyodai  
- Parking: Limited parking space near Koyodai Viewpoint Rest House (check availability in advance)

ã€What to Bring & Wearã€‘
- Sturdy hiking or trekking shoes (uneven terrain, roots, small steps)  
- Comfortable clothing plus a light jacket (cool temperatures and wind at higher elevation)  
- Water (few places to buy drinks along the way)  
- Hat and sunscreen (sun can be strong on clear days)  
- Rain gear (mountain weather can change quickly)  
- Camera or smartphone (be mindful not to block the trail with tripods)

ã€Good Shots for Videoã€‘
- Mt. Fuji seen from the Koyodai viewpoint area  
- Close-up shots of the dirt trail, roots, and fallen leaves  
- Walking POV shots that capture the rhythm of footsteps and forest sounds  
- Seasonal changes in the trees (fresh green, deep summer green, autumn colors, winter trees)

ã€Safety Notesã€‘
- Trails may become slippery in rain or snowâ€”avoid pushing too hard in bad conditions  
- Hiking shoes are safer than regular sneakers on uneven ground  
- If hiking alone, let someone know your route and expected return time  
- Please carry out all trash and respect the mountain environment

Video filmed in January 2026. Enjoy the peaceful atmosphere of Koyodai and the Tokai Nature Trail at the foot of Mt. Fuji.

This is Mount Fuji as seen from Lake Motosu on the Yamanashi Prefecture side.
This is the famous image of Mount Fuji that also appeared on the old 1,000 yen bill.
There is less snow around Fuji this year, but its beauty is exceptional.
The closer you get, the more you'll be overwhelmed by its sheer size.

In this episode, we travel to Kawaguchiko.
The moment we step off the train, we see the breathtaking Mount Fuji,
standing magnificently not far away.

Even though the weather is cold,
the view in front of us completely captures our attention.
Standing before such a great mountain, we forget ourselves.
We also fulfilled a dream we talked about three years ago
by visiting the place we once drew together,
turning that painting into reality.

title: [Front view]Fujisan View Express. Otsuki Station â†’ Kawaguchiko Station
description:
This is the railway company closest to Mt. Fuji. It is 26.6km from Otsuki Station (altitude 358m) to Kawaguchiko Station (altitude 857m). The maximum gradient is 40â€°.


0:35              Originally a JR Tokai train

0:40              The day I made the reservation was a day of heavy snow, so I went for two rides.

0:50              There are also many direct express trains operated by JR East from Shinjuku Station.

1:10             Inside car no. 1

2:00             The first car seat has unlimited drinks. I chose the Â¥6,000 sweets plan.
Macaroons, eclairs, chocolate mousse (with matcha mousse inside)It was delicious

2:26             It was snowing so I couldn't see anything.

2:47             There is also a wide selection of in-car sales. I ordered cookies and dorayaki. If you run out of drinks, they will call out to you right away. Be careful not to drink too much           Car 2 (reserved seat)

4:20             Car 3 (unreserved seating)

4:40             JR Otsuki Station

5:17             Fujikyu Otsuki Station

8:15             departure

9:30             Junction with JR line

12:54           Mount Fuji comes into view from around here.

13:50           Passing the Fujisan Express

16:16           The elevated track in front is the linear motor car test track.

17:45           Mount Fuji in front

23:52           Tsuru University Station

41:27           Shimoyoshida Station

45:37          A spectacular view from around here

49:00          Mount Fuji Station (This is a switchback station, so from here on you have to go backwards)

51:27          Fuji-Q Highland Station

55:18          Kawaguchiko Station

58:00          Overtourism at Kawaguchiko Station

title: Les 12 coups de midi : Cyprien tente le diable, un nouveau titre pour le champion de Jean-Luc
description:
Les 12 coups de midi : Cyprien tente le diable, un nouveau titre pour le champion de Jean-Luc Reichmann

Jean-Luc Reichmann animÃ© une nouvelle Ã©dition de lâ€™Ã©mission Les 12 coups de midi ce jeudi 22 janvier 2026 sur lâ€™antenne de TF1. La veille, Cyprien a Ã©tÃ© un peu dÃ©stabilisÃ© par lâ€™animateur.

Ce jeudi 22 janvier 2026, alors que TF1 a annoncÃ© le lancement de la nouvelle saison de LÃ©o Mattei : brigade des mineurs avec Jean-Luc Reichmann dans quelques semaines, la chaÃ®ne propose une nouvelle Ã©dition de lâ€™Ã©mission Les 12 coups de midi Ã  la mi-journÃ©e.
La veille, Cyprien a Ã©tÃ© opposÃ© Ã  Armelle. Ils ont frÃ´lÃ© le coup de maÃ®tre mais, manque de chance, ils nâ€™ont pas Ã©tÃ© assez rapides. Le maÃ®tre de midi, qui a Ã©tÃ© Ã©mu par une de ses idoles, nâ€™a pas eu lâ€™occasion de proposer un nom pour lâ€™Ã©toile mystÃ©rieuse alors que cette derniÃ¨re est totalement dÃ©couverte.


Les 12 coups de midi : TF1 leader des audiences
CÃ´tÃ© audiences, cette nouvelle Ã©dition de lâ€™Ã©mission Les 12 coups de midi a rÃ©uni 2,93 millions de personnes ce mercredi 21 janvier 2026 sur lâ€™antenne de TF1 entre 11h50 et 12h45, soit 38,3% de part de marchÃ© auprÃ¨s des quatre ans et plus. Lâ€™Ã©mission, prÃ©sente sur la Une depuis le 28 juin 2010, a convaincu jusquâ€™Ã  4,2 millions de FranÃ§ais au cours de la diffusion. Câ€™est le meilleur score pour le jeu en part de marchÃ© depuis le 30 septembre dernier.
Sur les cibles commerciales, le rendez-vous a captivÃ© 37% des femmes responsables des achats de moins de cinquante ans, ainsi que 31% des 15/24 ans et 44% des 4/14 ans. Sur les 25/49 ans, Jean-Luc Reichmann Ã©tablit un record de saison avec 34% de part de marchÃ©.
Par rapport Ã  la semaine passÃ©e, le rendez-vous est en hausse de 2,4 points de part de marchÃ©. GrÃ¢ce Ã  ces scores, TF1 est restÃ©e maÃ®tresse de la mi-journÃ©e. En frontal, la suite des aventures de Vincent dans Tout le monde veut prendre sa place a convaincu 1,69 million de curieux sur lâ€™antenne de France 2, soit 21,3% du public global.


Les 12 coups de midi : Cyprien accuse le coup aprÃ¨s avoir frÃ´lÃ© lâ€™Ã©limination
Cyprien, la veille, a donc frÃ´lÃ© le dÃ©part de lâ€™Ã©mission Les 12 coups de midi . Il est revenu sur cette belle frayeur dans lâ€™Ã©dition de ce mercredi 21 janvier 2026 sur lâ€™antenne de TF1. Le chef dâ€™orchestre a pris cela avec ironie. â€œAh, ce serait bien que ce soit un peu serrÃ©, un peu difficile aujourdâ€™huiâ€, a-t-il assurÃ©.
Jean-Luc Reichmann a soulignÃ© que le maÃ®tre de midi avait tentÃ© le diable lors de sa prÃ©cÃ©dente participation. Le prÃ©sentateur de lâ€™Ã©mission quotidienne lui a alors dÃ©cernÃ© un nouveau titre : le maÃ®tre de midi passÃ© le plus de fois au rouge. Cyprien a accueilli ce nouveau statut avec humour et lâ€™a rappelÃ© tout au long du numÃ©ro.
Les 12 coups de midi est Ã  retrouver quotidiennement Ã  11h50 sur lâ€™antenne de TF1.

title: FUJISAN IN AUTUMN | best season| Klook one day tour| know about prices, journey, iterinary, views
description:
ğŸ—» Mount Fuji Day Trip from Tokyo | Klook One Day Tour | Japan Vlog ğŸ‡¯ğŸ‡µ
In this vlog, Iâ€™m taking you along on a one-day Mount Fuji tour from Tokyo, booked through Klook.
This was a guided bus tour with pickup and drop from Tokyo Station, costing around Â¥4,000 per person, making it one of the easiest and most budget-friendly ways to explore Mt. Fuji.
We visited some of the most iconic spots around Mount Fuji including:
ğŸ“ Kawaguchiko Lake â€“ peaceful lake views with Mt. Fuji in the background
ğŸ“ Lawson Mt. Fuji viewpoint â€“ the viral photo spot
ğŸ“ Arakura area â€“ scenic walk surrounded by maple trees
ğŸ“ Oshino Hakkai â€“ a traditional village with crystal-clear spring water
The journey itself was beautiful â€” as we moved away from Tokyo, the views slowly changed from city skyscrapers to Japanese countryside, farms, mountains, and small towns. Even though the weather was a bit cloudy, the experience was totally worth it.
After a long day of travel and walking, we ended the day with a comforting meal at our favourite Nepali restaurant in Tokyo, which had been our go-to place for the last few days.
If youâ€™re planning a short trip to Japan and want to see Mount Fuji without any hassle, this kind of one-day tour is a great option.
ğŸ‘‰ Donâ€™t forget to like, comment, and subscribe for more Japan travel vlogs as the journey continues from Tokyo to Osaka!

title: [fr] Ã©popÃ©e de zÃ©ro ! :D merci pour les follows !
My wife threw me out! Needed a warm shelter to sleep!
description:
Kicked Out... So I Built a Shelter in the Wild to Survive the Night!

This was definitely not part of the planâ€¦ After a fight, my wife kicked me out. Instead of crashing in my car, I grabbed some tools, a bit of gear, and headed deep into an abandoned, wild spot to ride out the night. The result? A last-minute survival hut, built from scratch in the middle of nowhere. Between emergency DIY, creepy night sounds, and a whole lot of solitude, this was one unforgettable night.

Le 12 juin 2018, au cÅ“ur de Paris, une prise dâ€™otages Ã©clate dans les bureaux de Mixicom, lâ€™agence de Cyprien, Squeezie et de plusieurs des plus grands youtubeurs franÃ§ais. Ce qui ressemble dâ€™abord Ã  un acte de folie isolÃ© rÃ©vÃ¨le rapidement un tout autre scÃ©nario : le forcenÃ© nâ€™est pas lÃ  par hasard, il vise les crÃ©ateurs de lâ€™agence.

Ã€ travers les tÃ©moignages exclusifs des survivants, des nÃ©gociateurs de la BRI, des enregistrements audios et des archives inÃ©dites, cette sÃ©rie documentaire reconstitue minute par minute le dÃ©roulement de ces quatre heures de siÃ¨ge. Un rÃ©cit sous haute tension qui explore les mÃ©canismes de la violence, la fascination pour la notoriÃ©tÃ© et les limites de la justice face Ã  la maladie mentale.

title: Jâ€™ai enquÃªtÃ© sur la prise dâ€™otage que Youtube veut oublier
description:
DÃ©couvrez la carte Mirror de Trade Republic avec ce lien â–º https://trade.re/ludoc20
Le programme Saveback est soumis Ã  conditions (plan dâ€™Ã©pargne actif â‰¥ 50 â‚¬, plafond de dÃ©penses mensuelles 1 500 â‚¬). Collaboration commerciale avec Trade Republic. Conditions et informations disponibles sur l'application Trade Republic

Synopsis :

Le 12 juin 2018, au cÅ“ur de Paris, une prise dâ€™otages Ã©clate dans les bureaux de Mixicom, lâ€™agence de Cyprien, Squeezie et de plusieurs des plus grands youtubeurs franÃ§ais. Ce qui ressemble dâ€™abord Ã  un acte de folie isolÃ© rÃ©vÃ¨le rapidement un tout autre scÃ©nario : le forcenÃ© nâ€™est pas lÃ  par hasard, il vise les crÃ©ateurs de lâ€™agence.

Ã€ travers les tÃ©moignages exclusifs des survivants, des nÃ©gociateurs de la BRI, des enregistrements audios et des archives inÃ©dites, cette sÃ©rie documentaire reconstitue minute par minute le dÃ©roulement de ces quatre heures de siÃ¨ge. Un rÃ©cit sous haute tension qui explore les mÃ©canismes de la violence, la fascination pour la notoriÃ©tÃ© et les limites de la justice face Ã  la maladie mentale.

Avec les interventions de Adrien Gabeaud, Christophe Molmy, Nicolas de la BRI, Georges Salinas, Sandrine Larremendy, Franck Bonnier, David-Olivier Reverdy, Johanna Rozenblum, Karine Jean, Christian Sainte, Michel Delpuech, Rudy Reichstadt, Dr Bilal Bendid, Dr Vincent MahÃ© et Christophe de la Police Judiciaire.

Les enregistrements audio, les images de l'intervention, les vidÃ©os des riverains et les extraits tÃ©lÃ©visÃ©s prÃ©sentÃ©s dans ce documentaire sont authentiques. Certaines images de vidÃ©osurveillance et vues aÃ©riennes sont des reconstitutions basÃ©es sur des recherches et des tÃ©moignages directs. Les noms de certains intervenants ont Ã©tÃ© volontairement masquÃ©s afin de prÃ©server leur anonymat, conformÃ©ment Ã  leur souhait.

title: Finally, From July 1st. Mt, Fuji opens. #japan #mtfuji #fujisan
Mount Fuji  Japanâ€™s Iconic Wonder! #mountfuji #fujisan #traveljapan #japon #visitjapan #japan #viral
description:
Mount Fuji is one of the most popular destinations for foreign visitors in Japan, and for good reason! Hereâ€™s why:  

### **1. Breathtaking Natural Beauty** ğŸŒ„  
Mount Fujiâ€™s **perfectly symmetrical cone shape** makes it one of the most visually stunning mountains in the world. Whether itâ€™s seen from Tokyo on a clear day, mirrored in the waters of Lake Kawaguchi, or surrounded by cherry blossoms in spring, the views are absolutely mesmerizing.  

### **2. Icon of Japan ğŸ‡¯ğŸ‡µ**  
Fuji isnâ€™t just a mountainâ€”itâ€™s a **symbol of Japan** itself. It has inspired countless artworks, from **Hokusaiâ€™s famous woodblock prints** to modern photography. Its presence in Japanese culture makes it a must-see for travelers looking to experience the countryâ€™s essence.  

### **3. A Bucket-List Climb ğŸ”ï¸**  
For adventure seekers, **climbing Mount Fuji** is an unforgettable challenge. Every summer, thousands of climbers take on the ascent, hoping to witness the **unreal sunrise from the summit, known as "GoraikÅ" (å¾¡æ¥å…‰).** Itâ€™s not just a hikeâ€”itâ€™s a **spiritual and personal achievement.**  

### **4. Easy Accessibility ğŸš„**  
Unlike many famous peaks around the world, Mount Fuji is **relatively easy to visit**. It's just a short train or bus ride from Tokyo, and there are **many scenic spots nearby**, like Fuji Five Lakes, Hakone, and Chureito Pagoda, offering incredible views without the need to climb.  

### **5. Cultural and Spiritual Importance â›©ï¸**  
Fuji has been considered **a sacred place for centuries**. Pilgrims have climbed it since ancient times, and itâ€™s closely tied to **Shinto and Buddhist traditions**. Shrines around the mountain add a spiritual dimension to its natural beauty.  

### **6. Stunning Views Year-Round ğŸŒ¸ğŸâ„ï¸**  
Mount Fuji **changes with the seasons**, making it a year-round attraction:  
- **Spring:** Cherry blossoms with Fuji in the background ğŸŒ¸  
- **Summer:** Climbing season and lush green landscapes â›°ï¸  
- **Autumn:** Vibrant red and orange maple leaves ğŸ  
- **Winter:** Snow-capped peak with crisp, clear skies â„ï¸  

Whether youâ€™re an artist, a photographer, a hiker, or just a traveler in awe of nature, **Mount Fuji is an unforgettable experience** that keeps visitors coming back! Would you want to visit or even climb it? â›°ï¸ğŸ”¥

Par ailleurs, au cours du jeu, Jean-Luc Reichmann, qui a rÃ©vÃ©lÃ© un secret sur Cyprien, sâ€™est dit Â« dÃ©pitÃ© Â». En effet, aprÃ¨s une question sur lâ€™animal qui pÃ¨te le plus, lâ€™animateur dÃ©couvre que câ€™est la vache. Il en profite pour faire un lien avec lâ€™actualitÃ© et avoue : Â« Je suis dÃ©pitÃ© ! Il nâ€™y aura pas une seule vache au salon de lâ€™agriculture cette annÃ©e. Mais bon, câ€™est la loi, câ€™est la rÃ¨gle. Il faut sâ€™y plier Â».
Cette Ã©dition des 12 coups de midi a rÃ©uni 2,72 millions de tÃ©lÃ©spectateurs, soit 35,8% de part de marchÃ© sur les quatre ans et plus. Sur une semaine, le jeu animÃ© par Jean-Luc Reichmann gagne 1,6 point de part dâ€™audience.
Cyprien tentera de conserver son rang de maÃ®tre de midi ce samedi 24 janvier 2026 dÃ¨s 11h50 dans Les 12 coups de midi sur TF1.

title: Mt. New Years Fuji Vlog! (w/KingğŸ‘‘)
description:
Join me and King as we almost get ourselves killed for somewhat mediocre photos yet again. 

King got nice photos! (mine were not so good...). 
Check him out on instagram! @yngwie_17 

As part of your annual new years tradition every new years eve we go to some place overlooking Mt. Fuji and wait for the first sunrise of the year.

Found this half finished project buried in my Final Cut library and decided to upload it rather than just throwing it away. Uploaded a year late but, you know what they say, better late than something something... Plz enjoy if you enjoy(if not then that's ok too I suppose..)

title: On continue lâ€™Ã©popÃ©e du Poussin des ombres avec @sultantruite | 6 septembre 2023
Overnight in Kawaguchiko to See Mt. Fuji | Japan's Golden Route Episode 4
description:
What's the best way to get up-close to Mt. Fuji?  You take a trip out to the lake-side town of Kawaguchiko.  Instead of a day-trip, we not only stayed a night here but we also rented a car to make our exploration even easier. Follow my 2 days with my parents to see what this itinerary can look like.

This is Part 4 of 5 from our 10 day Japan itinerary that follows a modern version of the Golden Route.  

If you're new here, we haven't done vlogs in awhile since our https://www.youtube.com/playlist?list=PLSauNrcHS9SCLc_u_6qDrR-nR_coZJ9oD and https://www.youtube.com/playlist?list=PLSauNrcHS9SAtRpF5VQp3x9VNg0yiJ1gh days.  We'd love to know what you think so don't be shy and leave us thoughts on how you've been liking (or disliking) this series.

title: Waterslides at Aqualand Saint-Cyprien, France
description:
Aqualand Saint Cyprien in France! Dive into some of the best waterslides in the world, right here in the stunning Mediterranean region. From exhilarating drops to high-speed turns, this amazing water park has it allâ€”captured entirely in immersive POV footage! ğŸ’¦

ğŸ„â€â™‚ï¸ Begin your thrilling journey by climbing up to the heart-racing heights of legendary waterslides like the Black Hole, an intense ride that plunges you into total darkness, or the Twister, where you'll twist and spiral at breathtaking speeds. Hold tight and brace yourself as you experience one of the most exciting water attractions in Europe from a first-person perspective! ğŸ¢

ğŸŒªï¸ Looking for even more excitement? Donâ€™t miss out on The Wave, an epic waterslide that'll shoot you down steep descents, making it a must-try for any adrenaline junkie. Feeling daring? Challenge yourself to conquer Niagara, a waterslide famous for its near-vertical dropsâ€”one of the craziest and most thrilling slides at Aqualand Saint Cyprien. ğŸ’¥

ğŸŒ´ When you're ready to slow down the pace, float along the relaxing currents of the Congo Riverâ€”perfect for a refreshing break between extreme waterslide action. Or maybe chill out at the parkâ€™s wave pool, known as Surf Beach, where you'll feel like you're swimming right in the ocean waves. ğŸï¸

ğŸ¹ After all that heart-pumping fun, recharge at Aqualandâ€™s various snack bars and eateries, conveniently placed throughout the park. Grab an ice-cold beverage, tasty snacks, or a full meal to keep your energy up for the next round of thrilling waterslide adventures. ğŸŒ­ğŸ¦

â˜€ï¸ Located in picturesque Saint Cyprien, near the vibrant city of Perpignan and the Mediterranean coast, Aqualand is perfectly positioned to offer an unforgettable water-filled day of adventure. Whether you're seeking the craziest slides or the most exhilarating attractions, Aqualand Saint Cyprien guarantees a day filled with excitement, fun, and unforgettable moments. ğŸŒŠğŸŒ

ğŸ’§ Experience waterslides you won't believe exist, with heart-stopping descents and rapid speeds that make Aqualand Saint Cyprien a paradise for waterslide enthusiasts from around the globe. See exactly what it's like to ride these fantastic attractions in full POV detailâ€”every twist, turn, and splash as if you're really there! ğŸ¤©

ğŸŒŸ Subscribe to WaterTube for more thrilling POV rides from the best waterslides in the world. Each video takes you right into the actionâ€”no talking, no distractionsâ€”just pure waterslide adrenaline. ğŸ’¦ğŸ”¥

ğŸ‘‰ Buckle up for the ride of your life and see why these are some of the most exciting and dangerous waterslides you'll ever encounter. Welcome to the ultimate waterslide experience at Aqualand Saint Cyprien! ğŸŒŠğŸš€

Fall colors framing Fuji. #autumn #arakurayama #mountfuji #japanautumn #fujisan #japantravel #japan
description:
Autumn at Arakurayama Sengen Park â€” where fiery leaves frame Mt. Fuji. This park is a famous spot offering spectacular views of Mt. Fuji during autumn and spring.
Best time to visit: Early morning for a clear view of Mt. Fuji and softer light.
Located in Fujiyoshida, Yamanashi Prefecture.
Easiest route: Shinjuku â†’ Otsuki (JR) â†’ Shimoyoshida Station (Fujikyu Railway) â†’ 10 min walk to the park entrance.

title: Mount Fuji erupts, turning peace into chaos #fujisan  #mountfuji #FujiView #JapanNature
description:
ğŸŒŠğŸ–¤ Welcome to Dreadflow.
Where fear meets catastrophe.

Thank you for joining us on this terrifying and breath-stealing journey.
Here on Dreadflow, we create AI-generated cinematic shorts
that imagine the raw force of nature â€”
from tsunamis swallowing cities to storms tearing through peaceful lives.

ğŸŒªï¸ On Dreadflow, youâ€™ll witness:
â€“ Towering waves crashing through cities
â€“ People facing the unimaginable
â€“ Moments frozen at the edge of chaos
â€“ The overwhelming power of nature, captured in slow motion

Every video is fictional, created with AI, but rooted in very real fear.
Not to frighten â€” but to remind.
To remind us of the fragile world we live in.
To remind us what we might lose.

ğŸ‘‰ What happens when the ocean turns against us?
Hit subscribe, and step into the rising storm,
the stillness before the flood,
and the world one moment before everything changes.

This is Dreadflow.
Feel the fear.
Feel the awe.

ã€è‹±èªç‰ˆã€‘

ã€Titleã€‘
Sankodai Viewpoint Hike - Three Lakes in One Panorama | Mount Fuji Base Scenic Trail

ã€Descriptionã€‘
Hiked to Sankodai viewpoint on Mount Fuji's slopes, experiencing a spectacular panorama where three distinct lakes are simultaneously visible. At 1,202.56 meters elevation, just 15 minutes from nearby Koyodai viewpoint, this hidden gem offers 360-degree vistas showcasing Mount Fuji, the vast Aokigahara forest, and the three Fuji Lakes - Saiko, Shoji, and Motosu. On clear days, the scale of this landscape takes your breath away.

ã€Visited Spotsã€‘
Koyodai parking lot â†’ Koyodai viewpoint â†’ Tokai Nature Trail â†’ Sankodai viewpoint â†’ Vast forest panorama

ã€About Sankodai Viewpointã€‘
Sankodai is a scenic observation platform at 1,202.56 meters elevation, positioned along the popular Tokai Nature Trail connecting Ashiwada Mountain to Narusawa. The name literally means "three-lake platform," as it's the unique vantage point where three Fuji Lakes (Saiko, Shoji, Motosu) become simultaneously visible. Located just 15 minutes uphill from Koyodai viewpoint, this scenic spot offers 360-degree panoramic views. Mount Fuji dominates the centerpiece while the vast Aokigahara forest sprawls dramatically below. A well-constructed wooden-deck viewpoint platform serves as a natural gathering place for hikers seeking respite and inspiration.

ã€Panoramic Featuresã€‘
The 360-degree vista centers on Mount Fuji with Aokigahara Jukai forest spreading majestically below. The simultaneous view of three Fuji Lakes is geographically unique to this location. On exceptionally clear days, South Alps peaks become visible on the distant horizon. Aokigahara forest spans approximately 3,000 hectares (about 23 times larger than Yoyogi Park), creating an overwhelming sense of scale. Autumn foliage season particularly transforms the landscape - the entire forest palette shifts to warm autumn colors, creating a "boundless ocean" effect beneath Mount Fuji's commanding presence.


ã€Hashtagsã€‘
#SankodaiViewpoint #MountFuji #ThreeLakes #Saiko #Shoji #Motosu #TokaiBatureTrail #AokigaharaJukai #Hiking #PanoramicView #FujiFiveLakes #ForestWalk #BeginnerFriendly #FujiGawaguchiko #Yamanashi #NatureExploration #ScenicViewpoint #Trekking #VlcanicLandscape #JapanAdventure
