ã€Titleã€‘
First-Time Sea of Trees Walk! Aokigahara Forest Trail from Saiko Yacho-no-Mori Park | Moss Landscape & Primeval Forestã€45-Minute Beginner Hikeã€‘

ã€Descriptionã€‘
ã€Video Overviewã€‘

I attempted a beginner-friendly walk through Aokigahara Jukai (Sea of Trees) at the foot of Mount Fuji!
Starting from Saiko Yacho-no-Mori Park, this is approximately 45 minutes of nature immersion surrounded by primeval forest.
Walking through the well-maintained Jukai forest trail, I experienced stunning moss landscapes, mountain views,
and the full magic of the Aokigahara forest. This route is perfect for first-time visitors!

ã€Visited Spotsã€‘
âœ… Saiko Yacho-no-Mori Park (Starting Point)
âœ… Jukai Gallery (Museum Exhibits & Bird Information)
âœ… Maruki-bune Boat Display Hall (Lake Saiko History)
âœ… Jukai Walking Trail (Mixed conifer & broadleaf forest)
âœ… Yamata-no-Orochi (Ancient Twisted Cypress)
âœ… Wild Bird Watering Hole (Trail Junction)

ã€Trail Timelineã€‘
9:53 AM - Arrived at Saiko Yacho-no-Mori Park
10:00 AM - Forest walk begins
10:20 AM - Reached Wild Bird Watering Hole (Junction Point)
10:45 AM - Trail direction toward Bat Cave route

ã€About This Trailã€‘
â€¢ Duration: ~45 minutes (one-way walk)
â€¢ Difficulty: Beginner Level (suitable for all ages)
â€¢ Highlights: Primeval forest, moss landscapes, Mount Fuji views
â€¢ Access: Fuji Subaru Bus to "Saiko Yacho-no-Mori Park" stop

ã€Trail Characteristicsã€‘
ğŸŒ² Well-maintained wide trail paths designed for beginner walkers
ğŸŒ² Numbered trail markers prevent getting lost
ğŸŒ² Experience both conifer (evergreen) and deciduous (broadleaf) trees
ğŸŒ² Contrary to popular myths, this is a living, vibrant forest full of life
ğŸŒ² Educational exhibits at Jukai Gallery showcase forest wildlife
ğŸŒ² Clean facilities with ample parking and restrooms

ã€Park Facilities at Yacho-no-Moriã€‘
ğŸ“ Jukai Gallery
ã€€- Taxidermy displays of local birds & animals
ã€€- Educational panels about forest ecosystem
ã€€- Hours: 9:00 AM - 5:00 PM (Closed Thursdays)

ğŸ“ Birdwatching Room
ã€€- Telescopes for bird observation
ã€€- Approximately 210 bird species visit this location

ğŸ“ Craft Workshop
ã€€- Traditional woodcraft experience (reservation required)

ğŸ“ Spacious Grass Square
ã€€- Mount Fuji viewing platform
ã€€- Ideal for picnics & photography

ã€About Aokigahara Jukaiã€‘
ğŸŒ³ Formed ~1,000 years ago on Mount Fuji's ancient lava flows
ğŸŒ³ Forest area: ~3,000 hectares (approximately 23x larger than Yoyogi Park)
ğŸŒ³ Primary tree species: Hinoki cypress, hemlock, and fir
ğŸŒ³ Dense moss coverage creates a surreal, otherworldly landscape
ğŸŒ³ Officially maintained trails ensure safe, easy walking

ã€What to Bring & Wearã€‘
âš  Light Jacket: Forest stays cool even during daytime
âš  Sturdy Hiking Shoes: Uneven terrain with exposed roots & steps
âš  Insect Repellent: Particularly in warm seasons
âš  Hat: Limited sunlight inside dense forest canopy
âš  Water Bottle: Limited drinking water stations along trail

ã€Access Informationã€‘
ğŸ“ How to Get There
- From Kawaguchiko Station, take Retro Bus "Saiko & Aokigahara Line" (~40 minutes)
- Get off at "Saiko Yacho-no-Mori Park" stop

ğŸ“ Parking
- ~40 spaces available
- FREE

ğŸ“ Operating Hours
- Park: Open year-round
- Jukai Gallery: 9:00 AM - 5:00 PM (Closed Thursdays)

ã€Reference Linksã€‘
Saiko Nature Center:
https://www.vill.fujikawaguchiko.lg.jp/

Video filmed January 2026.
A perfect introduction for first-time Aokigahara visitors!

title: FUJINOMIYA: Shiraito Falls, Fujisan Sengen Shrine, yakisoba â€” Day Trip from Tokyo // ENG, UA sub
description:
#japan #daytrip #fujinomiya

This August I decided to climb Mount Fuji for the 4th time. But I came to Fujinomiya the day before the climb and tried to visit the most popular and interesting places. I bought a ticket for GORIKI-kun (å¼·åŠ›ãã‚“) â€” Fujinomiya City Routine Sightseeing Bus (afternoon course) which is available on weekends and holidays. And in one day I managed to visit the Mt. Fuji World Heritage Centre, Shiraito Falls, Lake Tanuki, Hitoana Fuji-ko Iseki, Fuji Milk Land, Takasago Brewery, Fujisan Hongu Sengen Taisha. I also ate yakisoba (traditional local food) and chilled in Hana-no-yu onsen. And I even witnessed a local festival on the central street! It was a very interesting and busy day. I hope you'll like this video.

title: JAPAN â€“ An Unforgettable Solo Journey | 2026 Cinematic After Movie
description:
"Japan isn't just a destination; itâ€™s a feeling. ğŸ‡¯ğŸ‡µ

In this cinematic after movie, I take you through my solo journey across the most beautiful country on planet earth. From the neon-lit streets of Osaka and the towering heights of Tokyo to the serene temples of Kyoto and the majestic silhouette of Mount Fuji, this is Japan like you've never seen it before. We also visit Hiroshima to pay respects at the Peace Memorial, a powerful reminder of resilience and peace.

Whether you're planning your own 2026 trip or just dreaming of the Land of the Rising Sun, I hope this film captures the magic and wanderlust of solo travel.

âœ¨ Locations Featured:

Kyoto: The vermillion gates of Fushimi Inari-taisha & the Arashiyama Bamboo Grove.

Osaka: The electric energy of Dotonbori at night and the urban sprawl.

Mount Fuji: Breathtaking, iconic views from the shores of Lake Kawaguchiko.

Nara: Walking with the sacred deer and visiting the local "gym cats."

Hiroshima: A solemn visit to the Atomic Bomb Dome, Peace Memorial Park, and Hiroshima Castle.

Chapters:
00:00 Mount Fuji
01:06 Kyoto
03:46 Osaka
07:09 Nara
09:40 Hiroshima

It is an active volcano and a symbol of Japanese culture

On clear days, Mount Fuji looks very stunning and peaceful
It is a UNESCO World Heritage Site and a popular tourist destination
Many visitors enjoy sightseeing, photography, and climbing Mount Fuji

Dans ce documentaire immersif au format Histoire pour dormir, nous explorons une hypothÃ¨se fascinante : celle dâ€™une carte stellaire dÃ©guisÃ©e, dissimulÃ©e dans lâ€™un des textes les plus anciens jamais retrouvÃ©s. Ã€ travers une narration lente et hypnotique, nous revisitons les tablettes sumÃ©riennes et akkadiennes, leurs images, leurs mÃ©taphores et leurs sÃ©quences troublantes. Le chemin de Gilgamesh, ses Ã©preuves, ses rencontres, ses seuils et ses transformations semblent correspondre Ã  des alignements stellaires prÃ©cis, Ã  des passages cÃ©lestes codÃ©s dans le rÃ©cit. Chaque monstre, chaque porte, chaque jardin sacrÃ© pourrait reprÃ©senter une zone du ciel, un point de bascule entre deux mondes.
Dans certaines interprÃ©tations marginales, le voyage vers lâ€™immortalitÃ© nâ€™est plus une quÃªte terrestre, mais une ascension cosmique. Enkidu, Humbaba, Uta-Napishtim, les Montagnes de Mashu, les Portes du Soleilâ€¦ autant de symboles qui, mis bout Ã  bout, dessinent une gÃ©ographie cÃ©leste cohÃ©rente. title: MT. FUJI WORLD HERITAGE CENTER / FUJISAN HONGU SENGEN TAISHA SHRINE / PINOY ENGINEER IN JAPAN
description:
The Mount Fuji World Heritage Center, Shizuoka is a museum in Fujinomiya dedicated to Mount Fuji. Opened in 2017 to commemorate the mountain's designation as a UNESCO World Heritage Site four years prior, the center boasts a viewing deck and a variety of exhibitions pertaining to the volcano's seismology, history and cultural significance. The building has an inverted conical form that reflects in the pond outside to reveal the shape of the iconic mountain.

HOW TO GO THERE:
The Mount Fuji World Heritage Center can be reached on foot in about ten minutes from Fujinomiya Station and is located along the main approach to Fujisan Sengen Shrine.


Fujisan Sengen Shrine is located in Fujinomiya City in the southwestern foothills of Mount Fuji. Originally built over 1000 years ago for the protection from volcanic eruptions, it has become the region's most important shrine and the head shrine of over 1300 Sengen and Asama shrines nationwide. The shrine is also a traditional starting point for climbing Mount Fuji.

HOW TO GO THERE:
Fuji Sengen Shrine can be reached on foot in about 10-15 minutes from Fujinomiya Station. Alternatively, buses operate between Fujinomiya Station and the shrine once every 1-2 hours. The one way ride takes between 5-10 minutes and costs 160 yen.
